strategy: debug: You are an ML research agent fixing bugs in a solution.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
train_data.fillna(train_data.mean(), inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(test_data.mean(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train_data = pd.get_dummies(train_data)
test_data = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation data
y_pred_val = model.predict(X_train)

# Calculate R2 score
val_r2 = r2_score(y_train, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test data
y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission dataframe
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})

# Save submission dataframe
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
for col in train_data.columns:
    if train_data[col].dtype == 'object':
        train_data[col] = train_data[col].astype(str)
        train_data[col] = train_data[col].fillna(train_data[col].mode()[0])
    else:
        train_data[col] = train_data[col].fillna(train_data[col].mean())

for col in test_data.columns:
    if test_data[col].dtype == 'object':
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].astype(str)
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].fillna(test_data[col].mode()[0])
    else:
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].fillna(test_data[col].mean())

# Encode categorical variables
train_data = pd.get_dummies(train_data)
test_data = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation data
y_pred_val = model.predict(X_train)

# Calculate R2 score
val_r2 = r2_score(y_train, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test data
y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission dataframe
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})

# Save submission dataframe
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
for col in train_data.columns:
    if train_data[col].dtype == 'object':
        train_data[col] = train_data[col].astype(str)
        train_data[col] = train_data[col].fillna(train_data[col].mode()[0])
    else:
        train_data[col] = train_data[col].fillna(train_data[col].mean())

for col in test_data.columns:
    if test_data[col].dtype == 'object':
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].astype(str)
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].fillna(test_data[col].mode()[0])
    else:
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].fillna(test_data[col].mean())

# Encode categorical variables
train_data = pd.get_dummies(train_data)
test_data = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Ensure test data has the same columns as training data
missing_cols = set(train_data.columns) - set(test_data.columns)
for c in missing_cols:
    test_data[c] = 0

extra_cols = set(test_data.columns) - set(train_data.columns)
test_data = test_data.drop(extra_cols, axis=1)

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation data
y_pred_val = model.predict(X_train)

# Calculate R2 score
val_r2 = r2_score(y_train, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test data
y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission dataframe
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})

# Save submission dataframe
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'EOF' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target variable from features
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Preprocess data
for col in X_train.columns:
    if X_train[col].dtype == 'object':
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode()[0])
    else:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mean())

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)

# Ensure test data has the same columns as training data
missing_cols = set(X_train.columns) - set(test_data.columns)
for c in missing_cols:
    test_data[c] = 0

extra_cols = set(test_data.columns) - set(X_train.columns)
test_data = test_data.drop(extra_cols, axis=1)

# Preprocess test data
for col in test_data.columns:
    if test_data[col].dtype == 'object':
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].astype(str)
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].fillna(test_data[col].mode()[0])
    else:
        test_data[col] = test_data[col].fillna(test_data[col].mean())

# Encode categorical variables in test data
test_data = pd.get_dummies(test_data)

# Split data into features and target
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation data
y_pred_val = model.predict(X_train)

# Calculate R2 score
val_r2 = r2_score(y_train, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test data
y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission dataframe
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})

# Save submission dataframe
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
EOF
